name: Flowers Grid
description: A grid of flower-like shapes created with overlapping ellipses in randomized pastel warm colors. Art inspired by Vera Molnárs use of repetition and grids in generative art - Code inspired by Bassima’s lecture (03/09)

name: Flowers Grid Variation
description: A variation of the first flower grid, using black and white instead of colors. The petals are oval-shaped like in the original, with added variation in size and stroke. Art inspired by Vera Molnárs use of grids, repetition, and small variations - Code inspired by Bassima’s lecture (03/09)

name: Flowers Grid Variation
description: A variation of the flower grid where each position is filled with layered, rose-like shapes. Random green stems and leaves are added to some of the flowers. Art inspired by Vera Molnárs use of grids, repetition, and variation - Code inspired by Bassima’s lecture (03/09)

name: Randomized Squares
description: A pattern of squares where each corner is slightly randomized, making the otherwise regular forms appear more alive and unpredictable. The work is inspired by Manfred Mohr’s interest in exploring variations within simple geometric structures
